After reading published information on various web sites, I called the hotel directly.  The person who answered the phone said the only room available was an "upscale" jacuzzi room for much more than the price listed on any web site.  When I balked, he said that another room might become available at a more moderate price, but still much more than internet prices.  When I inquired about the internet price, he said that his hotel did not work with any internet sites and that you could not trust the information listed thereon.  From other reviews I have read, he is correct.  All the web sites listing this hotel call it a "hidden jewel".  I would not trust that description.

We booked two rooms at the Ana Mesa Suites hotel via the RedTagHotels website in October 2002. That site, along with others, describes Ana Mesa Suites as "a hidden jewel of hospitality".   It has reason to hide...  We hadn't seen the property, and were (at the time) unfamiliar with Costa Mesa. However, we did check out the area surrounding the property.  It was an upscale business park;  we figured this hotel would be a typical business travelers establishment.  Uh--wrong!    The lobby prominently featured a "no room parties" sign.
